intro: Prenanthes sikkimensis, commonly known as the Sikkim watercress, is a herbaceous plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery flavor, similar to that of watercress. It is valued both for its culinary use and its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
